item.title: New study sheds light on ChatGPT’s alarming interactions with teens
item.description: ChatGPT will tell 13-year-olds how to get drunk and high, instruct them on how to conceal eating disorders and even compose a heartbreaking suicide letter to their parents if asked, according to new research from a watchdog group.

item.title: Unlikely friendship heals two troubled lives in “Dorothy’s Dictionary”
Third sex toy thrown onto court at WNBA game
item.description: Another sex toy was thrown onto the court at a WNBA game.

item.title: Putin says he hopes to meet Trump as the White House presses for a peace deal on Ukraine
item.description: The meeting would be a significant milestone in the more than 3-year-old war between Russia and Ukraine, though there’s no promise it would lead to the end of the fighting.

item.title: Fort Stewart shooting suspect was out on bond at the time of the shooting, records show
item.description: Sgt. Quornelius Radford is suspected of shooting five other soldiers on the Fort Stewart army installation on Wednesday.

item.title: FHP still seeing triple-digit speeders despite ‘Super Speeders’ law
item.description: Troopers recently arrested a man driving 105 miles per hour near Charlotte County.

item.title: Passenger in fatal Bradenton crash charged with tampering with evidence
item.description: Robert Viera was arrested Aug. 4 after investigators viewed surveillance video.

item.title: New grant allows for water testing in south Sarasota County bays
item.description: Suncoast Waterkeeper will be able to add eight new bacteria testing sites.

item.title: New Florida law bans use of cell phones in elementary and middle schools
item.description: Until now, state law only prohibited cell phone use during instructional time.

item.title: New pattern locked in, with high amounts of moisture, giving us good rain chances
Charlotte County firefighters battle blaze at pool company building
item.description: The Charlotte County and State Fire Marshals are investigating.

item.title: ABC7’s Chalkboard Champions ‘Day of Giving’ is today! Donate to Suncoast teachers & students
item.description: You can make a difference for kids this upcoming academic year.
